medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic hypercalcemia, hypercalciuria, and recurrent nephrolithiasis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient first symptomatic of kidney stones in early 20s. Admitted at age 33 with recurrent right renal calculi and elevated serum calcium levels (10.7 to 11.5 mg/dL). Symptoms persisted despite surgical interventions. At age 72, hospitalized with fatigue and confusion due to increased hydrochlorothiazide dose, with a serum calcium rise to 15.8 mg/dL.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic hypercalcemia and hypercalciuria diagnosed at age 44, with a history of recurrent kidney stones.
medical_history.family_history: Patient knows of no calcium or renal stone difficulties in parents, but a deceased maternal cousin had a 'calcium problem.'
